background.description: All devices communicate using a common <<acronym_md_lan>> protocol
A Time Source (TS) Service is on the <<acronym_md_lan>> network

scenarios.title: Device is connected to the MD LAN network with a Time Source service

specification.description: Device has detected at least one <<acronym_ts_service>>
The <<acronym_ts_service>> is operational
The device will synchronize its time with the <<acronym_ts_service>>

scenarios.title: Device is connected to the MD LAN network and a user wants to change the device's time

specification.description: Device is operational in <<acronym_md_lan>> network
The user attempts to change the time on the device manually
The device will disable the ability to change its time manually

scenarios.title: Device is connected to the MD LAN network and cannot connect to a TS Service

specification.description: Device has just connected to the <<acronym_md_lan>> network and has not detected any <<acronym_ts_service>>s
The <<acronym_ts_service>> is not operational or inaccessible
The device will not participate on the <<acronym_md_lan>> network until it detects and connects to a <<acronym_ts_service>>

scenarios.title: Devices are operational in the MD LAN network but cannot access the TS Service

specification.description: Device is operational on the <<acronym_md_lan>> network
The <<acronym_ts_service>> is no longer operational or otherwise inaccessible
The device will rely on its internal clock for time synchronization
The device will provide the accuracy of its clock in its <<acronym_mdib>>
The device will periodically attempt to reconnect to the <<acronym_ts_service>>
The device will notify the user about the fact, that the <<acronym_ts_service>> cannot be reached
The device will create a log entry noting the disconnection from the <<acronym_ts_service>>
The ability to change the device time manually will remain disabled

scenarios.title: Devices are operational in the MD LAN network but cannot access the TS Service and clock drift is unacceptable

specification.description: The <<vol1_spec_sdpi_p_actor_somds_participant>> is operational on the <<acronym_md_lan>> network
The <<acronym_ts_service>> is no longer operational or otherwise inaccessible
The clock drift of the device internal clock exceeds an internal threshold
The timestamps of the received data are no longer accurate enough
The device will notify the user that time synchronization is no longer functional, which will limit the availability of SDC System Functionality
The device will create a log entry noting inaccurate time synchronization
The device will periodically attempt to reconnect to the <<acronym_md_lan>> and <<acronym_ts_service>>
Based on a <<term_manufacturer>>'s risk management, the device may be disconnected entirely from the <<acronym_md_lan>> network.

scenarios.title: A device, operational in the MD LAN network, determines a non-slewing time adjustment is required

specification.description: The device is operational on the <<acronym_md_lan>> network,
The device's <<term_clock_discipline_algorithm>> determines an <<term_abrupt_time_adjustment>> is required,

The device will create a log entry that includes at least a <<term_timestamp>> for the adjustment in both the <<term_time_reference_frame>> before and after the <<term_abrupt_time_adjustment>> was made,

The <<vol1_spec_sdpi_p_actor_somds_provider>> will notify <<vol1_spec_sdpi_p_actor_somds_consumer>>s, using its system function contributions (<<acronym_sfc>>), of the change to the provider's <<term_time_reference_frame>>,
The <<vol1_spec_sdpi_p_actor_somds_provider>> will initiate a new MDIB sequence.

scenarios.title: A somds consumer, operational in the MD LAN network, receives data affected by an abrupt time adjustment

specification.description: The <<vol1_spec_sdpi_p_actor_somds_consumer>> is operational on the <<acronym_md_lan>> network,

The <<vol1_spec_sdpi_p_actor_somds_consumer>> receives notifications and/or <<acronym_mdib>> state indicating a <<vol1_spec_sdpi_p_actor_somds_provider>> has made abrupt time adjustment to its device clock,
The <<vol1_spec_sdpi_p_actor_somds_consumer>> will notify next users of data of suspicious timestamps.

background.description: All devices communicate using a common <<acronym_md_lan>> protocol
At least one ICU <<system_type_dashboard>> display
Devices in the room have already been assigned to the <<system_type_dashboard>>

scenarios.title: Devices are Accessible to the Dashboard

specification.description: Dashboard has detected at least one assigned accessible ICU device
the ICU devices are communicating on the <<acronym_md_lan>>
the <<system_type_dashboard>> will display parameter, waveform, alarm, setting, imagine, etc. information from all assigned accessible devices

scenarios.title: ICU Devices are Inaccessible to the Dashboard

specification.description: Dashboard cannot detect any assigned accessible ICU devices
the <<system_type_dashboard>> will display an error message

scenarios.title: One or more ICU devices become Inaccessible to the Dashboard

specification.description: <<system_type_dashboard>> cannot detect a previously detected assigned ICU device
the <<system_type_dashboard>> will display an error message

background.description: All devices communicate using a common <<acronym_md_lan>> protocol
At least one ICU Dashboard display
Devices from specific ICU rooms have been assigned to the Dashboard

scenarios.title: ICU Devices are Accessible to the Dashboard

specification.description: Dashboard has detected at least one assigned accessible ICU device
the ICU Devices are communicating on the <<acronym_md_lan>>
the Dashboard will display parameter, waveform, setting, alarm, imaging, etc. information from those devices (based on configuration)

scenarios.title: ICU Devices are Inaccessible to the Dashboard

specification.description: Dashboard cannot detect any assigned accessible ICU devices
the Dashboard will display an error message

scenarios.title: One or more ICU Devices are Inaccessible to the Dashboard

specification.description: Dashboard cannot detect any previously assigned accessible ICU devices
the Dashboard will display an error message

background.description: All devices communicate using a common <<acronym_md_lan>> protocol
There is at least one Data <<system_type_device_gateway>> (<<acronym_dgw>>) Service
All devices report either a device label and/or location
A <<acronym_dgw>> Service is associated with a specific set of device labels, and/or location(s) (i.e., devices in scope)

scenarios.title: New in scope device is connected to network with <<acronym_dgw>> service

specification.description: The <<acronym_dgw>> Service has detected a new in scope device
The <<acronym_dgw>> Service is operational
The <<acronym_dgw>> Service will connect to the device and export data to the EHR using the HL7 v2 based IHE DEV DOR actor of the DEV DEC Profile

scenarios.title: <<label_system_type_name_dgw>> Service is connected to the EHR

specification.description: The <<acronym_dgw>> Service is exporting data to the EHR
The <<acronym_dgw>> Service will comply with all IHE DEV / PCD DEC Profile DOR actor functional and test requirements

scenarios.title: <<label_system_type_name_dgw>> Service has a failure

specification.description: The <<acronym_dgw>> Service was connected to in scope devices and to an Enterprise system and fails
The <<acronym_dgw>> Service will backfill its data store and then backfill to the EHR when it recovers from its failure

scenarios.title: <<label_system_type_name_dgw>> Service connection to the Enterprise System fails

specification.description: The Enterprise System stops receiving data from the <<acronym_dgw>> Service
There is a communications failure between the <<acronym_dgw>> Service and the Enterprise System
The <<acronym_dgw>> Service will backfill missed data to the Enterprise System when communications resumes

background.description: All devices communicate using a common <<acronym_md_lan>> protocol
At least one Alert <<system_type_device_gateway>> (AGW) Service on the <<acronym_md_lan>> network
At least one <<system_type_clinical_notification_system>> is connected to the AGW Service
All devices report either a device label and/or location and/or patient ID
The AGW Service is associated with a specific set of device labels, and/or location(s) (Scope)

scenarios.title: New device is connected to network with AGW service

specification.description: the AGW Service has detected a new device in its scope
the AGW Service is operational
the AGW Service will connect to the device and communicate alerts to the Clinician Notification System

scenarios.title: The AGW service loses connectivity with the ICU devices

specification.description: the AGW Service no longer communicates with ICU devices in its scope
There is a communications failure
the AGW Service will notify the Clinician Notification System of the failure
when the AGW Service regains communication with the devices it will resume reporting active alerts to the Clinician Notification System

scenarios.title: The AGW service fails

specification.description: the AGW Service fails
the Clinician Notification System will detect a loss of communications with the AGW Service
when the AGW Service recovers it will resume reporting active alerts to the Clinician Notification System

scenarios.title: The Clinician Notification System loses connectivity with the AGW

specification.description: the Clinician Notification System can no longer communicate with the AGW Service
the Clinician Notification System will detect a loss of communications with the AGW Service
when connectivity recovers, the Clinician Notification System will resume reporting active alerts

background.description: All devices communicate using a common <<acronym_md_lan>> protocol
At least one <<label_system_type_name_agw>> (<<acronym_agw>>) Service on the <<acronym_md_lan>>
At least one Alert Recording System is connected to the <<label_system_type_name_agw>> (<<acronym_agw>>) Service
All devices report either a device label and/or location and/or patient ID
The AGW Service is associated with a specific set of device labels, and/or location(s)

scenarios.title: New device is connected to network with AGW service

specification.description: the AGW Service has detected a new device in its scope
the AGW Service is operational
the AGW Service will connect to the device and communicate alerts to the Alert Recording System

scenarios.title: The AGW service loses connectivity with the ICU devices

specification.description: the AGW Service no longer communicates with ICU devices in its scope
There is a communications failure
the AGW will notify the Alert Recording System of the failure
when the AGW regains communication with the devices it will resume reporting active alerts to the Alert Recording System and attempt to backfill any missing alerts

scenarios.title: The AGW service fails

specification.description: the AGW fails
the Alert Recording System will detect a loss of communications with the AGW
when the AGW Service recovers it will resume reporting active alerts to the Alert Recording System and attempt to backfill any missing alerts

scenarios.title: The Alert Recording System loses connectivity with the AGW

specification.description: the Alert Recording System can no longer communicate with the AGW
the Alert Recording System will detect a loss of communications with the AGW Service
when the AGW Service regains communication with the Alert Recording System it will resume reporting active alerts to the Alert Recording System and backfill any missing alerts.
